item.title: Grass verges STILL not being cut, 17th June
item.description:
Outside 34 Abbotswood road. The grass cutters were in the area today but still did not cut our verges. In fact they have not been cut this year since Gloucester County Council took over grass cutting responsibility from Tewkesbury Council. A previous report stated that this problem had been resolved which is totally incorrect.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbotswood Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Residents need further detailed info on forthcoming works, 17th June
item.description:
The village of Shipton has been advised of resurfacing works in the village from Tuesday 24th June 2025 until Friday 4th July 2025 but requires further details, for example: 1. will the whole area be closed off for the 9 days or will this be done in stages? 2. If the latter, what is the schedule/sequence? 3. Where are residents in the affected areas to park during the works? 4. How will residents in the affected areas gain access to their properties during the works? (some residents have properties only accessible via the main road. They have no access via a pavement or via alternative routes to their premises). 5. What will happen about the school bus services? How will children be collected if the school bus is unable to get through the village. 6. What will happen if vehicles are left in the affected areas? (for example by a visitor who has no sight of the works) 7. What will happen about private deliveries being attempted to residents' premises? Residents are very keen to work with the Highways department to minimize disruption and delays to the works and this can be best supported by providing better details in advance. Regards Parish Councillor Andy Gibbs -07552 283345 andy.gibbs@shipton-village.uk
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: One way sign faded and needs replaced, 17th June
item.description:
The one way sign opposite the exit from The Royal is faded and needs replaced. It cannot be seen easily and there have been reports of cars turning right into oncoming traffic. There wasn't a sub-category for faded sign do I had to use this sub-category instead.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gladstone Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
